00011 uint64_t EagleUtils_GetAbsoluteTime(void)
00012 {
00013     /* return the mocked time */
00014     if(0 != EagleUtils_MockAbsoluteTime) {
00015         return EagleUtils_MockAbsoluteTime;
00016     }
00017     
00018     /* return the true absolute time */
00019     return mach_absolute_time();

00022 char* EagleUtils_ToLowerCaseCopy(const char *str)
00023 {
00024     unsigned long len;
00025     char *r;
00026     
00027     if(NULL == str) {
00028         return NULL;
00029     }
00030     
00031     len = strlen(str) + 1;
00032     r = (char*) EagleMemory_Allocate("EagleUtils_ToLowerCaseCopy.1", len);
00033     if(NULL == r) {
00034         return NULL;
00035     }
00036     
00037     memmove(r, str, len);
00038     EagleUtils_ToLowerCase(r);
00039     return r;
00040 }
00041 
00042 void EagleUtils_ToLowerCase(char *str)
00043 {
00044     unsigned long i;
00045     
00046     for(i = 0; i < strlen(str); ++i) {
00047         str[i] = (char) tolower(str[i]);
00048     }
00049 }
00050 
00051 EagleBoolean EagleUtils_CompareWithoutCase(const char *s1, const char *s2)
00052 {
00053     size_t s1len, i;
00054     
00055     /* if either of the strings is NULL then don't both comparing them, however if they are both NULL then we must
00056      return EagleTrue */
00057     if(NULL == s1 || NULL == s2) {
00058         return (NULL == s1 && NULL == s2);
00059     }
00060     
00061     /* the strings are different lengths, so also don't bother comparing them */
00062     s1len = strlen(s1);
00063     if(strlen(s2) != s1len) {
00064         return EagleFalse;
00065     }
00066     
00067     /* check each character */
00068     for(i = 0; i < s1len; ++i) {
00069         if(tolower(s1[i]) != tolower(s2[i])) {
00070             return EagleFalse;
00071         }
00072     }
00073     
00074     /* the strings must be equal */
00075     return EagleTrue;
00076 }
